Why do we need dithering? | Dan Hollick
item.description:
Before we all mute the word 'dithering' I thought I'd explain a little bit about why we needed to dither digital images in the first place.
Although it's an aesthetic now, we used to need dithering to trick our eyes into seeing more colors than were actually there. üëá

item.title: AI Doom Predictions Are Overhyped | Why Programmers Aren‚Äôt Going Anywhere - Uncle Bob's take
item.description:
#AI #Programming #TechCareers #ArtificialIntelligence #ChatGPT #AIHype #SoftwareDevelopment #GraceHopper #AITools #TechMyths #unclebob
Are AI doomsayers right that programmers will soon be obsolete? Or is this just clickbait fear-mongering? In this video, we break down: Why early programmers panicked when Grace Hopper introduced compilers How AI tools like ChatGPT compare to human intelligence The repeating cycles of hype and disappointment in AI history Why software development is far from fully automatable The risks of pivoting careers based on AI ‚Äúdoom predictions‚Äù AI is a tool, not a replacement‚Äîfor now. Understand the trends, separate hype from reality, and make informed career decisions.
Sources: https://youtu.be/HD0L3lQ9cms?si=4skwzUgqKYMHC9Op
item.author: (Dev Tools Made Simple)
